intro: Gularia crenulata, commonly known as the wrinkled gularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and subtle blooms. Gularia crenulata is relatively low maintenance and can be cultivated in gardens or containers with proper care.
